page.title: 12WARRINGTON ACADEMY
page.content: {The Warrington Academy In 1757 a private house was converted into a science academy. It was the first of its kind in the country and was considered to be one of Britain's most important educational institutions. It was closed down in 1786 through lack of financial support and remained closed until 1899, when it was re-opened and used for a time by the local Literary and Philosophical Society. In 1981 the Academy came back into the news when it was resolved either to demolish it or move it for a road-widening scheme. It was moved about 75 feet north on rollers and grease-pads to its new resting place at the foot of Bridge Street. The Academy is now used by the Messenger Newspaper (U.K. Ltd.)
